definition: drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell

sentences.english: There are disco squelches and native drums.
sentences.chinese: 那裏還有迪廳的雜聲和來自本地的鼓聲。

sentences.english: I could hear the distant drums and sounds of bugle calls were coming from afar.
sentences.chinese: 我可以聽到正在來自遠方的敲鼓聲和號角發出的叫嘯。

sentences.english: With the cheerful deafening sound of gongs and drums, firecrackers, long jump dance.
sentences.chinese: 隨着歡快震耳欲聾的鑼鼓聲，鞭炮聲，龍跳躍起舞。

sentences.english: The drums seemed to throb in his ears.
sentences.chinese: 陣陣鼓聲彷佛在他耳邊震響。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, a gang of muggers heard the boy's drumming.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，一夥強盜聽到了男孩的鼓聲。

sentences.english: In the sound of gongs and drums for celebrating rich harvest, you radiate extraordinary splendour of youth.
sentences.chinese: 在歡慶豐收的鑼鼓聲中，你綻放青春的異彩。

sentences.english: They danced to the accompaniment of cymbals and drums.
sentences.chinese: 他們伴隨着鑼鼓聲跳舞。

sentences.english: Party in a cheerful sound of gongs and drums kicked off.
sentences.chinese: 聯歡會在一片歡快的鑼鼓聲中拉開序幕。
號角聲和鑼鼓聲迴盪山谷。

sentences.english: At once we hear the drums and the squawk of trumpets .
sentences.chinese: 我們便立刻聽到了鼓聲和刺耳的喇叭聲。

sentences.english: He finds drumbeats and other sounds he wants to use on a record.
sentences.chinese: 他找到了鼓聲和其他想用在錄音上的聲音。

sentences.english: Drums were pounding in the distance.
At this time, they heard the sounds of drumming and saw the Qi's army charging head-on.
sentences.chinese: 這時，齊軍營中響起戰鼓聲，士兵們向魯軍衝來。

sentences.english: A drum roll preceded the most dangerous part of the performance.
sentences.chinese: 演出快進行到最驚險的部分時響起了咚咚的鼓聲。
它包括兩個不同的鑼鼓聲。

definition: (of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on
sudden clap of thunder/fig. surprising turn of events
suona, Chinese shawm (oboe), used in festivals and processions or for military purposes/also written 鎖吶|锁呐/also called 喇叭[la3 ba5]
lit. as if weeping and complaining (idiom)/fig. mournful (music or singing)
